main event: A long silvery object was observed in the sky, moving low over the horizon during a 1-2 minute sighting.
interesting points: The object was observed by the master of the SS KOREAN BEAR ship while the ship was en route from Japan to San Francisco.
The object appeared to be hovering, was elongated in shape, emitting a brilliant light, and traveling at an estimated speed of approximately 1300 knots.
The object was being observed with binoculars and continued on a course bearing 140 degrees at an altitude of 20 degrees, before disappearing into a heavy cloud formation.
The sighting was confirmed by two other officers and appeared similar to other satellite and missile tests observed in the past, but did not correspond to any known aircraft.
The master of the ship, who reported the sighting, was described as a sincere and intelligent individual who had provided reliable information in the past.
witnesses: master and officers of the SS KOREAN BEAR ship
